STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 4, 2023
Jamie L Lemay
MARQUETTE/ALGER/SCHOOLCRAFT MDHHS
234 W BARAGA AVE,
MARQUETTE, MI, 49855-4710
Re: License #: CP520201281
Dear Jamie L Lemay:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
July 12, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90 calendar days
thereafter.
One of seven treatment plans reviewed was completed late. The plan was due June
8, 2023, and was completed on June 14, 2023.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
07/15/2022 Renewal. CAP approved 07/22/2022.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall,
at a minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as
follows, unless a greater frequency is medically
indicated:
(i) For a child under 2 years of age, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 3
months before being placed in foster care or a new
2

physical examination shall be completed within 30
calendar days after being placed in foster care.
One of three files reviewed lacked a current “well Child” exam.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
Case Opening (ISP) Within 30 calendar days before or 14
calendar days after case opening. Case Plan Reassessment
(USP) Within 30 calendar days before the case plan due
date.
One of seven FTM’s reviewed was completed more than thirty days from the service
plan due date. The service plan was due June 8, 2023, and the FTM was held May
2, 2023. A second FTM dated February 24, 2023, was incomplete.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
07/15/2022 Renewal. CAP approved 07/22/2022.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
One of seven medical passports reviewed was not updated with current medical
information. The last passport was dated February 16, 2023, and a “Well Child” was
completed on February 24, 2023, and a dental exam was completed on April 11,
2023. The exams were not documented in the passport.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
07/15/2022 Renewal. CAP approved 07/22/2022.
7/30/2021 INTERIM, CAP approved 9/7/2021
8/5/2020 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/3/2020
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
3

• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative caregivers,
and unrelated court ordered caregivers.
One of seven treatment plans reviewed documented a late
a signature. A USP dated December 16, 2022, was signed
by the parent on April 6, 2023.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
07/15/2022 Renewal. CAP approved 07/22/2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assistance was not provided at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period. There were four repeat violations established during the current
interim inspection. The original violations were established during the renewal
inspection completed on July 15, 2022 and an approved CAP was received on
July 22, 2022.
A corrective action was approved on June 23, 2023 in response to violations
established in special investigation #2023C0000202.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was reviewed. The report documented that
there were no identified barriers to compliance with the rules and policy. The
4

report detailed various tools the agency utilizes to assist supervisors and staff in
maintaining compliance.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported that they feel supported by their supervisors and that
supervision provides knowledgeable supervision. Staff also reported that they feel
they are part of supportive team.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a local DHHS office. The agency is spacious and well maintained.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified two safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are
as follows:
Safety Alert #1. A safety alert was generated on March 6, 2023, as the master
bedroom in the home was found to be lacking a door. The agency was contacted on
the above said date and a special evaluation was initiated. Resolution was obtained
by March 13, 2023. A photo of the installed door was provided.
Safety Alert #2. The CPA Analyst generated a safety alert on March 7, 2023, as a
child was found to be using the basement as a bedroom and there is no egress. The
agency reported that the home is closing their license and closure paperwork was
entered into CWLM.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
August 4, 2023
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
